intro: Antidesma kuroiwae, commonly known as the Kuroiwa antidesma, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide range of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, green leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
